definition: good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He brought the company a good omen of a lot of money when he took over the position.
sentences.chinese: 他刚一上任就为公司带来了钱谷广进的好彩头。

sentences.english: Hotel design company opened the eighth day good luck.
sentences.chinese: 酒店设计公司初八开业好彩头。

sentences.english: Go to resist a castle treasure-house, rend away now a time world the premier colourful head of general assembly.
sentences.chinese: 前往御殿宝库，抢走今次天下第一武道大会的彩头。

sentences.english: To win the respect of rival, is after appropriate point heat to the losers.
sentences.chinese: 赢得对手的尊重，就是得手后适当的反点彩头给输家。

sentences.english: They have also been publicity ornaments used by local officials to boost their standing.
sentences.chinese: 一些地方官员还利用这些宣传彩头来谋求职位升迁。

definition: tip given on a happy occasion (traditional)
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to drink as the result of having lost a bet
